markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Terotricus](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3215)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

The legendary terotricus is a massive slime mold that hails from the [Outer Rifts](/Planes.aspx?ID=45). Its collective consciousness encapsulates entire regions, spreading as far as its ever-growing cloud of spores will take it. Once it has seeped into [the Universe](/Planes.aspx?ID=26) from the Rifts, a terotricus's agenda is to feed on all living creatures, infecting them with its spores, and its presence can spell doom for any in its way.

 Terotricuses move by rapidly expanding and contracting their slimy “bodies,” which are capable of burrowing through soil, gliding across water, and scrabbling up steep slopes. These behemoths of rot don't need to travel to see their plans come to fruition, though; their spores easily latch onto demons and other denizens of the Outer Rifts, who in turn bring this blight to the Universe when the fiends are summoned.

 When a terotricus infects a creature with its spores, web-like fungal growths start appearing on the victim's skin until they cover the entire body, at which point the victim's mind is also subdued and bent to the terotricus's will. The terotricus's favored victims include animals, elves, and fey, though it is happy to infect any creature it can catch. Cults of [Treerazer](/Monsters.aspx?ID=394) occasionally attempt to make contact with a terotricus, but such acts almost always simply result in a new sect of spore-blighted servants.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Fungus](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 44

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 42

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 39
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Terotricus.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 19">[Terotricus](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3215)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=683" />
<trait label="Gargantuan" />
<trait label="Fungus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=614" />
<trait label="Unholy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=521" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 326 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Perception** +31; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=82) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 120 feet

**Languages**
[Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114), [Elven](/Languages.aspx?ID=4), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119)

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +37, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +32, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +35, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +31, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +31

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +10

**Dex** +5

**Con** +9

**Int** -1

**Wis** +6

**Cha** +5
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 42 

**Fort** +34 

**Ref** +28 

**Will** +33 

+1 status to all saves vs. [magic](/Traits.aspx?ID=644)
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 370

, regeneration 25 (deactivated by [cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=555))

</row>

**Immunities**
[controlled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=64), [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=696)

**Resistances**
[fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 15

**Weaknesses**
[cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=555) 15, [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2916) 15, [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) 15, slashing 10

**Spore Cloud** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578)) 30 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn there is exposed to spore blight.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 35 feet; burrow 25 feet, climb 25 feet, swim 35 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
tentacle +37 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)),
**Damage** 4d10+18 bludgeoning plus 2d6 spirit and [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66) or [Improved Push](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=66) 20 feet

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
spores +37 ([Brutal](/Traits.aspx?ID=249), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range increment 80 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)),
**Damage** 4d8+8 poison plus 2d6 spirit, spore blight, and sticky spores

**Infest Environs** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) **Frequency** once per day; **Requirements** The terotricus is in a swamp or forested area; **Effect** The terotricus drains nutrients from nearby trees and undergrowth while simultaneously infesting them with fungal growth. All non-magical plant life (though not [plant](/Traits.aspx?ID=668) creatures) within a 60-foot emanation withers and sprouts foul mold and slimy mushrooms, removing any [cover](/Rules.aspx?ID=459) and [concealment](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62)provided by trees and undergrowth. In addition, the terotricus regains 200 Hit Points (this is a [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623) [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509) effect).

**Spore Blight**  ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46)) [Plants](/Traits.aspx?ID=668)and [fungi](/Traits.aspx?ID=614)are immune; **Saving Throw** DC 40 Fortitude; **Stage 1** [enfeebled 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=71) (1 day); **Stage 2** enfeebled 4 and [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92) (1 day); **Stage 3** [controlled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=64) by the terotricus (as [_dominate_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1501); 5d8 days); **Stage 4** dead

**Sticky Spores**   A creature hit by a terotricus's spores takes a –10-foot status penalty to all its Speeds for 1 minute. If the Strike was a critical hit, the creature is also [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=81) until it [Escapes](/Actions.aspx?ID=2296) (DC 40).

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Terotricus Myths</title>

The Kellids of Sarkoris dealt with their fair share of terotricuses during the era of the Worldwound, and these people developed unique rituals to purify tainted grounds with the help of ancestral spirits and feathers acquired from [celestials](/Traits.aspx?ID=551). Far south of there, in what is now known as the Sodden Lands, wastelanders who learn of the presence of a terotricus—or “swampblight,” as they're called there— carry lanterns blessed by angels in the hopes that these lights will keep the terotricus at bay.
</aside>
name: Terotricus
